intro: Leptocarpus modestus, commonly known as the dwarf sea grape, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cymodoceaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of the Philippines and Indonesia. This plant is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of white flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in brackish or saline water, making it an important species in coastal ecosystems. Leptocarpus modestus is often used in traditional medicine and is valued for its adaptability to harsh marine environments.
